links.description: Until recently, companies that beat quarterly earnings estimates could routinely expect their shares to rise, sometimes dramatically. Not anymore. This year so far, many earnings overachievers have seen small price gains, or even declines. It's unclear why. One theory is that buyers' fatigue is setting in more than eight years into the second-longest bull market in U.S.
links.title: Wall Street's Real Earnings Surprises
